column4: Hey, I was wondering if anybody has experienced that after upgrading from 12.04 to 12.10, then display is fixed to 1024x768?
what videocard and how did you install your drivers in 12.04?
drivers were automatically installed in 12.04 - videocard is ATI Mobility Radeon HD 4570
radeon should work fine. maybe check your Xorg.0.log and xrandr output
which directory do they usually end up in?
xrandr is a program, logfiles are in /var/log/
xrandr output: xrandr: Failed to get size of gamma for output device. Screen 0: Minimum 1024 x 768, current 1024 x 768, maximum 1024 x 768
check your log then
tbh I don't know where to look ;-)
pastebin it
http://pastebin.com/NHj6Xhny
you don't use the standard driver. you use fglrx. use the ubuntu standard driver "radeon"
ok, thank you. I'll try google for an answer how to do that :-)
changing from fglrx to radeon would mean editing /etc/X11/xorg.conf from Section "Module" < Load "glx" < Endsection to "radeon", right?
no. it would mean to uninstall all fglrx packages and remiving xorg.conf
sounds like console work, eh? ;-)
see? Sicp has the same problem
that would make it a known bug, eh? ;-)
depends. what happened is, amd stopped supporting 4000 series GPUs with their driver
oh...
but since you had the driver installed with 12.04 or whatever, it simply updated the package to the new driver which doesn't support the gpu anymore
ok, I've removed everything related to fglrx - I'll try rebooting
thanks for the help :-)
just a quick thanks - that did the trick :-)
